book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters, by Dr. Basim Faisal Al-Jawabra, Assistant Professor at the College of Sharia and Fundamentals of Religion, Al-Qassim.
foot_note: None

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Praise be to Allah, Lord of the Worlds, and His blessings and peace be upon the best of Messengers and upon all his family and companions. As for what follows: This is the supplementary section regarding Brothers and Sisters, which I have added as a supplement to the book of Ali bin Al-Madini and the book of Abu Dawood Al-Sijistani.
1 - Aban bin Khalid Al-Hanafi. ... 2 - And Abdul Mu'min bin Khalid.
3 - Ibrahim bin Ismail bin Mujammi'. ... 4 - And Dawud bin Ismail. ... 5 - And Muhammad bin Ismail.
foot_note:
1. 1 - Mentioned by Al-Hafiz in *Ta'jil al-Manfa'ah* (13), and he said about him: His brother Abdul Mu'min; Al-Azdi considered him soft (layyin). Al-Dhahabi said: His report is rejected (munkar). Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/268; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/454, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/298, *Al-Mizan* 1/6, *Al-Lisan* 1/21.
2 - Abu Khalid Al-Marwazi, the Judge, there is no harm in him (la ba's bihi), from the seventh [generation] / D T S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/117, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/66, *Al-Thiqat* 7/137, *Al-Tahdhib* 6/432.
3 - Al-Ansari Abu Ishaq Al-Madani, weak, from the seventh [generation] / Kh T Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/271, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/84, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/105.
4 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 3/231, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/406, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/282. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Ibrahim and Muhammad bin Ismail bin Mujammi'.
5 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/35, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 7/188, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/394. Al-Bukhari said: I see him as the brother of Ibrahim. Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Ibrahim.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
6 - Ibrahim bin Abi Bukayr. ... 7 - And Musa bin Abi Bukayr.
8 - Ibrahim bin Hamid bin Abdul Rahman bin Awf. ... 9 - And Abdul Rahman bin Hamid.
9/A - And Al-Qasim bin Hamid.
10 - Ibrahim bin Abi Hafsah. ... 11 - And Salim bin Abi Hafsah.
12 - Ibrahim bin Talhah. ... 13 - And Shu'ayb bin Talhah. ... 14 - And Uthman bin Talhah. 15 - And Muhammad bin Talhah.
foot_note:
1. 6 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/90, and he said: Ibrahim bin Abi Bukayr... his brother Musa narrated from him.
7 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 8/137, and he said: He narrated from his brother Ibrahim.
8 - Al-Zuhri, from the eighth [generation]. Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/4, saying he died in the year 178. Mentioned by Al-Hafiz in *Al-Taqrib* to distinguish him from Ibrahim bin Hamid Al-Ru'asi, and he mentioned him in *Al-Tahdhib* 1/117 within the biography of Hamid Al-Ru'asi.
9 - Previously mentioned 1/131.
9/A - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/331 and he said: The brother of Abdul Rahman bin Hamid.
10 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/282, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/96, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/8. Al-Bukhari said: It is said that he is the brother of Salim. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Salim bin Abi Hafsah.
11 - Al-Ajli Abu Yunus Al-Kufi, truthful (Saduq) in Hadith except that he was an extremist Shi'ite, from the fourth [generation], died around 140 / Bukhari, T; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 4/111, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/180, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/433. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Ibrahim.
12 - Ibrahim bin Talhah bin Ubaydullah bin Abdul Rahman bin Abi Bakr Al-Siddiq. Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/295, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/107, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/56. Al-Bukhari said: I see him as the brother of Uthman and Shu'ayb. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Uthman and Shu'ayb.
13 - Mentioned by Al-Dhahabi in *Al-Mizan* 2/277, and he said: Ibn Ma'in said: I do not know him. Abu Hatim said: There is no harm in him; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 4/222, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/349, *Al-Thiqat* 6/439, and *Al-Lisan* 3/148. Al-Bukhari said: I see him as the brother of Muhammad. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Muhammad.
14 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 6/229, and he said: From his brother Ibrahim bin Talhah, and he was a master (Sayyid).
15 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/121, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 7/291, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/367.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
16 - Ibrahim bin Abdul Rahman bin Abdullah bin Abi Rabi'ah. ... 17 - And Muhammad bin Abdul Rahman.
18 - Ibrahim bin Umar bin Kaysan. ... 19 - And Hafs bin Umar. ... 20 - And Muhammad bin Umar. ... 21 - And Wahb bin Umar.
22 - Ibrahim bin Muhammad bin Abi Yahya. ... 23 - And Abdullah bin Muhammad bin Abi Yahya.
24 - Ibrahim bin Muhajir bin Jabir. ... 25 - And Muhammad bin Muhajir.
foot_note:
1. 16 - Al-Makhzumi, acceptable (maqbul), from the third [generation] / Kh S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/296, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/111, *Al-Thiqat* 4/10, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/138.
17 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/151, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 7/316, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 5/358. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: We see him as the brother of Ibrahim bin Abdul Rahman. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Ibrahim.
18 - Al-Yamani Abu Ishaq Al-San'ani, truthful (Saduq), from the seventh [generation] / D S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/307, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/114, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/147. Al-Hafiz said in *Al-Tahdhib*: They are four brothers: Ibrahim, Muhammad, Hafs, and Wahb, the sons of Umar bin Kaysan.
19 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 2/365, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/177, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/198.
20 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/177, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 8/20, and Al-Hafiz in *Al-Lisan* 5/321. Abu Hatim said: I do not know him.
21 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 8/169, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 9/27, and Abu Hatim said: Unknown (Majhul). Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Ibrahim, Muhammad, and Hafs, sons of Umar.
22 - Al-Aslami Abu Ishaq Al-Madani, abandoned (Matruk), from the seventh [generation], died in the year 184, and it is said 191 / Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/323, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/125, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/158.
23 - His nickname is Sahbal, possibly attributed to his grandfather. Trustworthy (Thiqah), from the seventh [generation], died in the year 172 / Bukhari, D; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 5/188, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 5/156, *Al-Thiqat* 7/43, *Al-Tahdhib* 6/20. Mentioned previously.
24 - Al-Bajali Al-Kufi, truthful (Saduq) but has soft memory, from the fifth [generation] / M 4; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/328, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/132, *Al-Mizan* 1/67, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/166.
25 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 8/90. Al-Hafiz said in *Al-Tahdhib* 9/487 =

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
26 - Ibrahim bin Yusuf bin Maimun. ... 27 - And Isam bin Yusuf.
28 - Ubay bin Abbas bin Sahl. ... 29 - And Abdul Muhaymin bin Abbas.
30 - Ubay bin Ajlan. ... 31 - And Abu Umamah bin Ajlan.
32 - Ahmad bin Al-Azhar. ... 33 - And Muhammad bin Al-Azhar.
34 - Ahmad bin Ishaq bin Zaid. ... 35 - And Yaqub bin Ishaq.
foot_note:
1. = in the biography of Muhammad bin Muhajir: Al-Qurashi. There are six people called Muhammad bin Muhajir mentioned by Al-Khatib; one of them is Kufi Bajali, the brother of Ibrahim.
26 - Al-Bahili Al-Balkhi, truthful (Saduq), they criticized him for Irja', from the tenth [generation], died in the year 240 or before it / S; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/148, *Al-Mizan* 1/76, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/184.
27 - Al-Hafiz said in *Al-Lisan* 4/168: Ibn Adi said: He narrated hadiths that are not corroborated. Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/521, *Al-Kamil* 5/2008, *Al-Mizan* 3/67. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Ibrahim. Ibn Adi said: Asim bin Yusuf and Ibrahim bin Yusuf are brothers.
28 - Al-Ansari Al-Sa'idi, has weakness, from the seventh [generation], he has only one hadith in Bukhari / Kh T Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/40, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/290, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/186.
29 - Weak (Da'if), from the eighth [generation], died after 170 / T Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/137, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/67, *Al-Tahdhib* 6/432.
30 - Mentioned by Ibn Al-Athir in *Usd al-Ghabah* 1/60 and said: He narrated from the Prophet, peace be upon him, and he is the brother of Abu Umamah; *Al-Isabah* 1/26.
31 - He is Suday bin Ajlan Al-Bahili, a famous Companion who lived in the Levant (Sham) and died there in the year 86 / A; *Usd al-Ghabah* 3/420, *Al-Isabah* 3/420, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/420.
32 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/44 and said: The brother of Muhammad bin Al-Azhar, he used to follow the school of Ra'y (opinion), he makes mistakes and differs; *Al-Lisan* 1/136.
33 - I did not find his biography. He was mentioned in the biography of his brother as stated above.
34 - Al-Hadrami Abu Ishaq Al-Basri, trustworthy (Thiqah), he used to memorize, from the ninth [generation], died in the year 211 / M D T S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/1, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/40, *Al-Thiqat* 9/283, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/14, Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Yaqub.
35 - Al-Hadrami, their Mawla, Abu Muhammad the Reciter and Grammarian, truthful (Saduq) from the younger ones of the ninth [generation], died in the year 205 / M D Tm S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 8/399, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 9/203, *Al-Thiqat* 9/283, *Al-Tahdhib* 11/382. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Ahmad.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
36 - Ahmad bin Al-Harith bin Abdul Rahman. ... 37 - And Bishr bin Al-Harith.
38 - Ahmad bin Harb Al-Ta'i. ... 39 - And Ali bin Harb.
40 - Ahmad bin Khalid Al-Wahbi. ... 41 - And Muhammad bin Khalid.
42 - Ahmad bin Abdul Malik bin Waqid. ... 43 - And Said bin Abdul Malik.
44 - Ahmad bin Muhammad bin Sa'id. ... 45 - And Yahya bin Muhammad.
foot_note:
1. 36 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/9 and said: The brother of Bishr the Ascetic from the people of Baghdad.
37 - Al-Marwazi, settled in Baghdad, Abu Nasr, the famous great Ascetic, trustworthy (Thiqah) and a role model, died in the year 227, and he was 76 years old / L As; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/356, *Al-Thiqat* 8/143, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/444.
38 - Al-Mawsili, truthful (Saduq), from the tenth [generation], died in the year 263, and he was 90 years old / S; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/49, *Al-Thiqat* 8/39, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/23. Ibn Abi Hatim and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Ali bin Harb.
39 - Truthful (Saduq) and virtuous, from the younger ones of the tenth [generation], died in the year 265, and he had exceeded ninety / S; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/183, *Al-Thiqat* 8/471, *Al-Tahdhib* 7/294.
40 - Al-Kindi Abu Said, truthful (Saduq) from the ninth [generation], died in the year 214 / R 4; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/2, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/49, *Al-Thiqat* 8/6, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/26.
41 - Al-Homsi, the brother of Ahmad, truthful (Saduq) from the ninth [generation], died before the year 190 / D S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/74, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 7/243, *Al-Thiqat* 9/66, *Al-Tahdhib* 9/143. Everyone who wrote his biography from those mentioned above said: The brother of Ahmad.
42 - Al-Harrani Abu Yahya Al-Asadi, trustworthy (Thiqah) spoken against without proof, from the tenth [generation], died in the year 221 / Kh S Q; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/61, *Al-Thiqat* 8/7, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/57. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Said.
43 - Abu Hatim said: They speak about him; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/45, *Al-Thiqat* 8/267, *Al-Lisan* 3/37. Ibn Abi Hatim and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Ahmad bin Abdul Malik.
44 - Al-Dhahabi said: Ibn Adi said: I saw them unanimous on his weakness, but Al-Khatib strengthened him. Ibn Adi said: He is not strong; *Al-Kamil* 1/202, *Al-Mizan* 1/140, *Al-Lisan* 1/267. Ibn Adi, Al-Dhahabi, and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Yahya.
45 - Al-Dhahabi said in *Al-Siyar* 14/501: The Imam, the proficient Hafiz, the Muhaddith of Iraq, knowledgeable in defects (Ilal) and narrators; *Tarikh Baghdad* 14/231, *Tadhkirat al-Huffaz* 2/776.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
46 - Ahmad bin Nasr bin Malik. ... 47 - And Salih bin Nasr.
48 - Ahmad bin Al-Nadr bin Abdul Wahhab. ... 49 - And Muhammad bin Al-Nadr.
50 - Ahmad bin Waki' bin Al-Jarrah. ... 51 - And Sufyan bin Waki'. ... 52 - And Malih bin Waki'.
53 - Idris bin Yazid bin Abdul Rahman. ... 54 - And Dawud bin Yazid.
foot_note:
1. 46 - Al-Khuza'i Abu Abdullah, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the tenth [generation], killed unjustly in the year 231 / L; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/6, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/79, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/86.
47 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/418, and he said: The brother of Ahmad bin Salih who was killed.
48 - Al-Naysaburi Abu Al-Fadl, trustworthy Hafiz from the eleventh [generation] / Kh; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/79, and he named him Ahmad bin Al-Nasr (with Sad), *Al-Tahdhib* 1/87.
49 - The brother of Ahmad, acceptable (Maqbul) from the twelfth [generation] / Kh; *Al-Tahdhib* 9/491. Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Ahmad, and their hearing [of Hadith] was the same. He said in the biography of Ahmad: When Al-Bukhari arrived in Nishapur, he would stay with the two brothers Muhammad and Ahmad.
50 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/51 and he said: He narrates from his father, and he is the brother of Falih and Sulaiman, the people of Kufa narrated from him. The commentator on *Al-Thiqat* noted that Falih and Sulaiman is a mistake, and the correct names are Malih and Sufyan.
51 - Abu Muhammad Al-Ru'asi Al-Kufi, was truthful (Saduq) but was afflicted by his scribe who inserted into his hadith what was not from it, so he was advised but did not accept, so his hadith fell (became rejected), from the tenth [generation] / T Q; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/31, *Al-Mizan* 2/173, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/123.
52 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 8/367, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 9/195. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Sufyan bin Waki'.
53 - Al-Awdi, trustworthy (Thiqah), from the seventh [generation] / A; *Al-Tabaqat Al-Kubra* 6/363, *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/37, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/263, *Al-Thiqat* 6/78, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/195. Ibn Sa'd, Al-Bukhari, and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Dawud.
54 - Abu Yazid Al-Kufi Al-A'raj, weak (Da'if) from the sixth [generation], died in the year 151 / Bukhari, T Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/239, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/427, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/205.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
55 - Ishaq bin Rafi' bin Umayr. ... 56 - And Ismail bin Rafi'.
57 - Ishaq bin Sulaiman Al-Razi. ... 58 - And Talhah bin Sulaiman.
59 - Ishaq bin Ubaydullah bin Sulaym. ... 60 - And Ismail bin Ubaydullah.
61 - Ishaq bin Isa Al-Tabba'. ... 62 - And Muhammad bin Isa.
63 - Ishaq bin Ka'b Al-Qurazi. ... 64 - And Muhammad bin Ka'b.
foot_note:
1. 55 - Abu Hatim said: He is not strong. Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/106. Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Ismail; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/219, *Al-Mizan* 2/219, *Al-Lisan* 1/362.
56 - Al-Ansari, settled in Basra, nicknamed Abu Rafi', has weak memory, from the seventh [generation], died around 150 / Bukhari, D T; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/354, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/168, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/294.
57 - Abu Yahya, originally from Kufa, trustworthy (Thiqah) and virtuous, from the ninth [generation], died in the year 200, and it is said before it / A; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/223, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/234.
58 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/483 and he said: The brother of Sulaiman Al-Razi, and he was a Quran reciter.
59 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/229, and he said: Mawla of the family of Uthman bin Affan.
60 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/367, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/183, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/43. All of them said: The brother of Ishaq.
61 - Abu Yaqub Al-Baghdadi, truthful (Saduq) from the ninth [generation], died in the year 214, and it is said a year later / M T S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/299, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/231, *Al-Thiqat* 8/114, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/245. Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Muhammad.
62 - Abu Ja'far, trustworthy (Thiqah) jurist, was among the most knowledgeable people about the hadith of Hushaym, from the tenth [generation], died in the year 224, and he was 74 / Kh T D Tm S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/203, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 8/38, *Al-Tahdhib* 9/392.
63 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/400, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/232, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/48. They said: The brother of Muhammad.
64 - Abu Hamza Al-Madani, he had settled in Kufa for a while, trustworthy (Thiqah) scholar, from the third [generation], born in the year 40, and died in the year 120, and it is said before that / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/216, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 8/67, *Al-Tahdhib* 9/420.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
65 - Ishaq bin Yunus. ... 66 - And Abdul Rahman bin Yunus.
67 - Asad bin Abdullah Al-Bajali. ... 68 - And Ismail bin Abdullah. ... 69 - And Khalid bin Abdullah.
70 - Ismail bin Ibrahim bin Abdul Rahman bin Abi Rabi'ah. ... 71 - And Musa bin Ibrahim.
72 - Ismail bin Al-Hasan Al-Atwari. ... 73 - And Yaqub bin Al-Hasan.
foot_note:
1. 65 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/238, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/114. Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Abu Muslim Al-Mustamli. Ibn Hibban said in *Al-Thiqat*: The brother of Abdul Rahman bin Yunus Al-Mustamli.
66 - Abu Muslim Al-Mustamli Al-Baghdadi, Mawla of Al-Mansur, truthful (Saduq), they criticized him for Ra'y (opinion), from the tenth [generation], died in the year 224 or after it / Kh; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 5/369, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 5/303, *Al-Tahdhib* 6/302.
67 - Al-Qasri, he was the governor of Khorasan, there is softness in his hadith, from the fifth [generation], died in the year 120 / S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/50, *Al-Thiqat* 4/57, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/259. Everyone who wrote his biography from those mentioned above said: The brother of Khalid.
68 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/180 and he said: The brother of Khalid Al-Qasri.
69 - Governor of Hijaz then Kufa, killed in the year 126, from the fourth [generation] / A Kh D; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/158, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/340, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/101.
70 - Al-Makhzumi Al-Madani, acceptable (Maqbul) from the sixth [generation] / S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/339, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/156, *Al-Thiqat* 6/29, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/272. Al-Bukhari said: I see him as the brother of Musa. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Musa.
71 - Acceptable (Maqbul) from the fourth [generation] / D S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 7/279, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 8/133, *Al-Tahdhib* 10/332.
72 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/351, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/165, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/19. Ibn Abi Hatim and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Yaqub bin Al-Hasan.
73 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 8/400, and Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 9/206, and they said: He narrated from his brother Ismail.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
74 - Ismail bin Zakariya bin Murrah. ... 75 - And Said bin Zakariya.
76 - Ismail bin Salim. ... 77 - And Muhammad bin Salim.
78 - Ismail bin Amr bin Shurahbil. ... 79 - And Said bin Amr.
80 - Ismail bin Mas'ud Al-Jahdari. ... 81 - And Al-Salt bin Mas'ud.
82 - Aswad bin Qays. ... 83 - And Ali bin Qays.
foot_note:
1. 74 - Al-Khalqani (with Damma on Kha and Sukun on Lam), Abu Ziyad Al-Kufi, truthful (Saduq) makes mistakes a little, from the eighth [generation], died in the year 194 and it is said before that / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/355, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/170, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/297.
75 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 4/23, Al-Dhahabi in *Al-Mizan* 2/137, and Al-Hafiz in *Al-Lisan* 3/29. They said: The brother of Ismail bin Zakariya, unknown (Majhul).
76 - Al-Asadi Abu Yahya Al-Kufi, settled in Baghdad, trustworthy and firm (Thiqah Thabt) from the sixth [generation] / Bukhari, M D S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/356, *Al-Jarh* 2/172, *Al-Thiqat* 6/32, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/301. Al-Bukhari and Al-Hafiz said: It is said he is the brother of Muhammad bin Salim, while Ibn Hibban stated it definitely.
77 - It did not become clear to me who he is, and it is possible that he is Muhammad bin Salim Al-Hamdani (with Sukun) Al-Kufi Abu Sahl, weak (Da'if) / T; but this one is Hamdani and that one is Asadi, and both are Kufan. See *Al-Tahdhib* 9/176.
78 - Bin Said bin Sa'd bin Ubadah. Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/28 and he said: The brother of Said bin Amr.
79 - Al-Ansari Al-Madani, from the descendants of Sa'd bin Ubadah, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the sixth [generation] / S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/498, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/49, *Al-Thiqat* 8/260, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/69.
80 - Abu Mas'ud Al-Basri, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the tenth [generation], died in the year 248 / S; *Al-Jarh* 2/200, *Al-Thiqat* 8/102, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/331. Ibn Abi Hatim and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Al-Salt.
81 - Abu Bakr or Abu Muhammad Al-Basri the Judge, trustworthy (Thiqah) perhaps hallucinates (makes errors), from the tenth [generation], died in the year 240 or a year before / M; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/441, *Al-Thiqat* 8/324, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/436.
82 - Al-Abdi, and it is said Al-Ijli, Al-Kufi, nicknamed Abu Qays, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the fourth [generation]; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/448, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/292, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/341.
83 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 6/293, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 6/201, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 5/165. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Al-Aswad.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
84 - Usayd bin Zuhayr bin Rafi'. ... 85 - And Anas bin Zuhayr.
86 - Usayd bin Abdul Rahman bin Zaid bin Al-Khattab. ... 87 - And Abdul Hamid bin Abdul Rahman. ... 87/A - And Umar.
88 - Umayyah bin Abdullah bin Khalid. ... 89 - And Khalid bin Abdullah. ... 90 - And Musa.
91 - Umayyah bin Amr bin Said bin Al-Aas. ... 92 - And Said bin Amr.
foot_note:
1. 84 - Al-Ansari Al-Awsi, he and his father were Companions, died in the Caliphate of Marwan; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/47, *Al-Isabah* 1/84, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/249.
85 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 2/28, Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/49, and Al-Hafiz in *Al-Isabah* 1/124. Ibn Hibban and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Usayd.
86 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 2/12, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/316, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/41. They said: The brother of Abdul Hamid.
87 - Al-Adawi Abu Umar, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the fourth [generation], died in Harran during the Caliphate of Hisham / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/45, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/15, *Al-Tahdhib* 6/115. (87/A) *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/171, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/120, Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 5/147. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Abdul Hamid. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: We see him as the brother of Abdul Hamid.
88 - Ibn Abi Al-Ays (with Kasra on the unpointed letter) Al-Makki, the brother of Khalid, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the third [generation], died in the year 87 / S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/7, *Al-Jarh* 2/301, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/371. Al-Bukhari and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Khalid.
89 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 3/158, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/339, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/257. Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Umayyah and Musa. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Umayyah.
90 - He was mentioned in the biography of his brother in *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/158, where Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Umayyah and Musa.
91 - Al-Umawi, the son of Al-Ashdaq, truthful (Saduq) from the sixth [generation] / Kh D; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/10, *Al-Thiqat* 6/70, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/372. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Musa, Said, and Muhammad.
92 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 3/499, and Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 4/49 and said: Abu Zur'ah was asked about him? He said: He is trustworthy. And mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/277. Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Umayyah and Musa.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
93 - And Muhammad. ... 94 - And Musa.
95 - Anas bin Abdul Hamid Al-Dabbi. ... 96 - And Jarir bin Abdul Hamid.
97 - Unayf bin Millah Al-Judhami. ... 98 - And Hayyan bin Millah.
99 - Aws bin Thabit bin Al-Mundhir. ... 100 - And Hassan bin Thabit.
101 - Aws bin Abdullah bin Buraydah. ... 102 - And Sahl bin Abdullah.
foot_note:
1. 93 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/192 and said: I see him as the brother of Musa, Said, and Umayyah. Mentioned by Ibn Hibban 5/357 and said: The brother of Musa and Said.
94 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 7/289, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 8/155, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/448.
95 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/289, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/448. They said: The brother of Jarir bin Abdul Hamid.
96 - Al-Kufi, settled in Rayy and was its judge, trustworthy (Thiqah) with correct writings, it was said he hallucinated from memory in his late life, died in the year 188, and he was 71 years old / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/214, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/505, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/75.
97 - Companion, lived in Ramla, and died in Bayt Jibrin, came as a delegate to the Prophet, peace be upon him; *Usd al-Ghabah* 1/160, *Al-Isabah* 1/140.
98 - Companion; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/53, *Usd al-Ghabah* 2/78, *Al-Isabah* 2/145. Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Unayf bin Millah.
99 - Companion, mentioned by Ibn Ishaq among those who witnessed Aqaba, Badr, and Uhud. Ibn Al-Athir and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Hassan; *Usd al-Ghabah* 1/165, *Al-Isabah* 1/144.
100 - Al-Ansari Al-Khazraji, the poet of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, famous, died in the year 54 and was 120 years old / Kh M D S Q; *Usd al-Ghabah* 2/5, *Al-Isabah* 2/62, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/247.
101 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 2/17, and said: There is some issue (Nazr) about him; *Al-Mizan* 1/278, *Al-Lisan* 3/120. All of them said: His brother Aws narrated from him.
102 - Ibn Hibban said: His hadith is Munkar; *Al-Majruhin* 1/348, *Al-Mizan* 2/239, *Al-Lisan* 3/120. All of them said: His brother Aws narrated from him.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
103 - Iyas bin Sahl bin Sa'd Al-Sa'idi. ... 104 - And Abbas bin Sahl.
105 - Iyas bin Afif Al-Kindi. ... 106 - And Yahya bin Afif.
107 - Ayyub bin Jabir Al-Suhaymi. ... 108 - Muhammad bin Jabir.
109 - Ayyub bin Abdullah bin Yasar. ... 110 - And Said bin Abdullah. ... 111 - And Salit bin Abdullah.
112 - Ayyub bin Al-Mutawakkil. ... 113 - And Abdul Rahman bin Al-Mutawakkil.
foot_note:
1. 103 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/36, and said: The brother of Abbas bin Sahl.
104 - Trustworthy (Thiqah) from the fourth [generation], died around 120, and it is said before that / Kh M D T Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 7/3, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/210, *Al-Tahdhib* 5/118.
105 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/441 and said: There is some issue (Nazr) about him; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/280, *Al-Thiqat* 4/34, *Al-Mizan* 1/282, *Al-Lisan* 1/475.
106 - Acceptable (Maqbul) from the third [generation] / S; *Al-Thiqat* 5/521, *Al-Tahdhib* 11/258.
107 - Abu Sulaiman Al-Yamami then Al-Kufi, weak (Da'if) from the eighth [generation] / D T; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/410, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/242, *Al-Mizan* 1/285, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/399. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Muhammad bin Jabir.
108 - Truthful (Saduq), his books were lost so his memory worsened, he mixed up a lot, became blind and would be prompted, from the seventh [generation], died after 170 / D Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/53, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 7/219, *Al-Tahdhib* 9/88.
109 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/419, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/251, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/26. Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Salit and Said.
110 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari 3/487, Ibn Abi Hatim 4/36, and Ibn Hibban 4/279. They said: The brother of Ayyub and Salit.
111 - Unknown (Majhul) from the third [generation] / Tamyiz; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/191, *Al-Jarh* 4/286, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/164. Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Ayyub.
112 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/424, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/259, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/126. Ibn Abi Hatim and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Abdul Rahman.
113 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/379, and said: Abu Sa'd the Reciter: From the people of Basra.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
Letter Ba'
114 - Al-Bara' bin Abi Nadrah. ... 115 - And Abdul Malik bin Abi Nadrah.
116 - Bashar bin Qirat. ... 117 - And Hammad bin Qirat.
118 - Bashar bin Kidam. ... 119 - And Mis'ar bin Kidam.
120 - Bishr bin Al-Ala' bin Zabr. ... 121 - And Abdullah bin Al-Ala' bin Zabr.
foot_note:
1. 114 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/110 and said: The brother of Abdul Malik bin Abi Nadrah.
115 - Al-Abdi Al-Basri, truthful (Saduq) perhaps makes mistakes, from the seventh [generation] / Kh D Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 5/434, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 5/370, *Al-Thiqat* 7/105, *Al-Tahdhib* 6/427. Ibn Hibban said: He is the brother of Al-Bara'.
116 - Abu Nu'aym Al-Nishapuri, Abu Zur'ah called him a liar, and Abu Hatim said: He is not to be used as proof; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/417, *Al-Mizan* 1/310, *Al-Lisan* 2/17. Al-Dhahabi and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Hammad bin Qirat.
117 - Abu Ali, Abu Zur'ah was asked about him and said: He was truthful (Saduq). Abu Hatim said: Disturbed (Mudtarib) in Hadith, his hadith is written but not used as proof; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/145, *Al-Thiqat* 8/206, *Al-Lisan* 2/352. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Bashar.
118 - Bashar bin Kidam (with Kasra on the first letter) Al-Sulami Al-Kufi. It is said he is the brother of Mis'ar, but Al-Daraqutni rejected that. Weak (Da'if) from the sixth [generation] / Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/128, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/416, *Al-Thiqat* 6/113, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/440. Al-Bukhari said: It is said: The brother of Mis'ar, while Ibn Hibban stated it definitely.
119 - Al-Hilali Abu Salamah Al-Kufi, trustworthy, firm and virtuous (Thiqah Thabt Fadil), from the seventh [generation], died in the year 153 or 155 / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 8/13, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 8/368, *Al-Tahdhib* 10/113.
120 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 2/79, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/363, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/06. They said: The brother of Abdullah bin Al-Ala'.
121 - Zabr (with Fatha on Zay and Sukun on the unified letter) Al-Dimashqi Al-Rib'i, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the seventh [generation], died in the year 164, and he was 89 / Kh 4; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 5/162, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 5/128, *Al-Tahdhib* 5/350. Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Bishr.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
122 - Bishr bin Ghalib Al-Azdi. ... 123 - And Bashir bin Ghalib.
124 - Bishr bin Quhayf Al-Amiri. ... 125 - And Maslamah bin Quhayf.
126 - Bakr bin Abdullah bin Amr Al-Muzani. ... 127 - And Alqamah bin Abdullah.
128 - Bahz bin Hakim bin Muawiyah. ... 129 - And Said bin Hakim. ... 130 - And Muawiyah bin Hakim.
foot_note:
1. 122 - Mentioned by Al-Dhahabi in *Al-Mizan* 1/322 and said: From his brother Bashir bin Ghalib. Al-Azdi said: Abandoned (Matruk); *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/81, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/363, *Al-Thiqat* 4/69. Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Bashir.
123 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 2/101, and Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/277, and they said: He narrated from his brother Bishr, and Al-Bukhari added: Disconnected (Munqati').
124 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 2/81, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 2/363, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/69.
125 - Mentioned by Ibn Sa'd in *Al-Tabaqat* 6/156, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 5/430. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Bishr.
126 - Abu Abdullah Al-Basri, trustworthy, firm and great (Thiqah Thabt Jalil), from the third [generation], died in the year 106 / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/90, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/388, *Al-Thiqat* 4/74, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/484. Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Alqamah.
127 - Al-Hafiz said in *Al-Taqrib*: His grandfather's name is Sinan, and it is said Amr, and that he is the brother of Khalid bin Bakr, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the third [generation], died in the year 100 / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 7/41, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/406, *Al-Thiqat* 5/210, *Al-Tahdhib* 7/245. Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Bakr. Al-Hafiz said: Al-Ajurri said: Abu Dawood was asked, 'Is Alqamah bin Abdullah the brother of Bakr bin Abdullah?' He said: No.
128 - Al-Qushayri Abu Abdul Malik, truthful (Saduq), died before the sixties / Kh T 4; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/142; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/430, *Al-Majruhin* 1/194, *Al-Mizan* 1/353, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/498.
129 - The brother of Bahz, truthful (Saduq), from the sixth [generation] / D S; *Al-Thiqat* 6/352, *Al-Mizan* 2/132, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/19. Ibn Hibban, Al-Dhahabi, and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Bahz.
130 - Acceptable (Maqbul), from the third [generation] / T; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 7/332, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 8/381, *Al-Thiqat* 7/467, *Al-Tahdhib* 7/205. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Bahz.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
Letter Ta'
131 - Tamim bin Hadhlam. ... 132 - And Abdul Rahman bin Hadhlam.
Letter Tha'
133 - Thabit bin Zaid bin Arqam. ... 134 - And Anisah bint Zaid bin Arqam.
135 - Tha'labah bin Suhaym. ... 136 - And Ma'ruf bin Suhaym.
Letter Jim
137 - Jabalah bin Harithah Al-Kalbi. ... 138 - And Zaid bin Harithah.
foot_note:
1. 131 - Tamim bin Hadhlam Al-Dabbi, Abu Salamah Al-Kufi, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the second [generation] / Kh T; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/153. See *Intikhab Kitab Man Wafaqat Kunyatuhu Ism Abihi* by Al-Khatib Al-Baghdadi, selected by Mughlatay, edited by the poor servant [author], biography number 28.
132 - Mentioned by Al-Khatib in *Al-Muwaddih li Awham Al-Jam' wal-Tafriq* 1/80 among those who narrated from his brother Tamim bin Hadhlam, and he also mentioned him in the book *Man Wafaqat Kunyatuhu Ism Abihi* in the biography of his brother Tamim.
133 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 2/162, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/94.
134 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/63.
135 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/499, within the biography of his brother Ma'ruf, and said: The brother of Tha'labah bin Suhaym.
136 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/499, and said: The brother of Tha'labah.
137 - Companion, brother of Zaid / T S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/217, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/508, *Usd al-Ghabah* 2/281, *Al-Isabah* 1/456, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/61; and everyone who wrote his biography from those mentioned above said: The brother of Zaid.
138 - Previously mentioned in the book of Ali bin Al-Madini, biography number 169.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
139 - Jabalah bin Amr bin Tha'labah. ... 140 - And Uqbah bin Amr Abu Mas'ud.
141 - Al-Jarrah bin Al-Dahhak Al-Kindi. ... 142 - And Isa bin Al-Dahhak.
143 - Ja'far bin Al-Muttalib bin Abi Wada'ah. ... 144 - And Abdul Rahman bin Al-Muttalib. 145 - And Kathir bin Al-Muttalib.
Letter Ha'
146 - Hajib bin Qudamah. ... 147 - And Abdul Hamid bin Qudamah. And Abdul Hamid is the brother of
foot_note:
1. 139 - Al-Ansari, Madani, he has companionship (Sahbah); *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/218, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/508, *Usd al-Ghabah* 2/28, *Al-Isabah* 1/457. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Abu Mas'ud.
140 - Abu Mas'ud Al-Badri, a great Companion, died before year 40, and it is said after / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/429, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/313, *Al-Isabah* 4/524, *Al-Tahdhib* 7/247.
141 - Al-Kufi, trustworthy (Thiqah), from the seventh [generation] / T; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/228, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/524, *Al-Thiqat* 6/157, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/65.
142 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/279 and said about him: There is no harm in him. Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/237. They both said: The brother of Al-Jarrah bin Al-Dahhak.
143 - Al-Sahmi, acceptable (Maqbul) from the sixth [generation] / S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/199, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 2/489, *Al-Thiqat* 4/105, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/108. Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Kathir.
144 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 2/350, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 5/283, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 5/81. Al-Bukhari said: I see him as the brother of Kathir.
145 - Abu Said Al-Makki, acceptable (Maqbul) from the third [generation] / D S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 7/208, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 7/156, *Al-Thiqat* 5/331, *Al-Tahdhib* 8/429.
146 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 3/78, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/284, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/237. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Abdul Hamid bin Qudamah through his father, and Abdul Hamid is the brother of Abdullah bin Sa'd bin Nawfal through his mother. Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Abdul Hamid through his father.
147 - Mentioned by Al-Dhahabi in *Al-Mizan* 2/542 and said: Al-Bukhari said: He is not corroborated; *Al-Du'afa* by Al-Uqayli 3/47. Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 5/126, *Al-Lisan* 3/396.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
148 - Abdullah bin Sa'd bin Nawfal through his mother.
149 - Al-Harith bin Al-Harith. ... 150 - And Khalid bin Al-Harith. ... 151 - And Sulaym bin Al-Harith.
152 - Hibban bin Juz'. ... 153 - And Khuzaimah bin Juz'.
154 - Habib bin Jahdar. ... 155 - And Khasib bin Jahdar.
156 - Habbah bin Khalid. ... 157 - And Sawa' bin Khalid.
foot_note:
1. 148 - Mentioned in the biography of Hajib as stated above.
149 - Mentioned in *Al-Thiqat* by Ibn Hibban 3/82 in the biography of his brother Khalid as will follow.
150 - Khalid bin Al-Harith bin Ubayd bin Sulaym Al-Juhaymi, Abu Uthman Al-Basri, trustworthy and firm (Thiqah Thabt) from the eighth [generation], died in the year 186 / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/145, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/325, *Al-Thiqat* 6/267, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/82. Ibn Hibban said: And they are brothers, Khalid and Al-Harith.
151 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 4/123, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/214, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/414. Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Khalid.
152 - Hibban bin Juz' (with Fatha on Jim then Zay, then Hamza), from the third [generation] / T Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/89, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/268, *Al-Thiqat* 4/181, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/171. Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Ibn Hibban said: He narrated from his brother Khuzaimah bin Juz'.
153 - Companion, the chain of narration to him is not authentic / T Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/206, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/382, *Al-Thiqat* 3/108, *Al-Isabah* 2/280, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/141. Everyone who wrote his biography from those mentioned above said: His brother is Hibban.
154 - Mentioned by Al-Dhahabi in *Al-Mizan* 1/451 and said: The brother of Khasib, Ahmad and Yahya called him a liar, as if they saw him; *Al-Kamil* by Ibn Adi 2/817, *Al-Mizan* 1/451, *Al-Lisan* 2/168.
155 - Mentioned by Al-Dhahabi in *Al-Mizan* 1/653 and said: Shu'bah, Al-Qattan, and Ibn Ma'in called him a liar; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/221, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/396, *Al-Lisan* 2/398.
156 - Al-Asadi, and it is said: Al-Amiri or Al-Khuza'i, a Companion who has one hadith, settled in Kufa / Bukhari Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/92, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/253, *Al-Isabah* 2/14, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/177. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Sawa' bin Khalid.
157 - The brother of Habbah, Companion who has hadith / Bukhari Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 4/202, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/321, *Al-Isabah* 3/216, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/265. Ibn Abi Hatim and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Habbah.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
158 - Habbah bin Salamah. ... 159 - And Shaqiq bin Salamah. ... 159/A - And Abdul Rahman bin Salamah.
160 - Al-Hajjaj bin Hassan Al-Qaysi. ... 161 - And Mughirah bint Hassan.
162 - Hajjaj bin Abi Uyainah. ... 163 - And Muhammad bin Abi Uyainah.
164 - Hajjaj bin Abi Al-Furat. ... 165 - And Yunus bin Abi Al-Furat.
166 - Al-Hajjaj bin Abi Mani'.
foot_note:
1. 158 - Mentioned by Al-Hafiz in *Al-Lisan* 2/167 and said: The brother of Abu Wa'il Shaqiq bin Salamah. Ibn Al-Qattan said: Unknown (Majhul).
159 - Abu Wa'il Al-Asadi Al-Kufi, trustworthy (Thiqah) Mukhadram (lived in Jahiliyyah and Islam), died in the Caliphate of Umar bin Abdul Aziz and he was 100 years old / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 4/245, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/371, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/361. (159/A) Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Abu Wa'il Shaqiq bin Salamah; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 5/290, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 5/241, *Al-Thiqat* 5/84.
160 - Al-Basri, there is no harm in him, from the fifth [generation] / D; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/379, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/157, *Al-Thiqat* 6/204, *Tahdhib al-Kamal* 5/434, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/200. Al-Mizzi said: He narrated from his sister Mughirah bint Hassan.
161 - Acceptable (Maqbulah), and it is among the strange names for women / D; *Al-Thiqat* 5/466, *Al-Kashif* 5/466. Ibn Hibban and Al-Dhahabi said: Her brother Al-Hajjaj bin Hassan narrated from her.
162 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 2/378, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/164, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/201. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Muhammad bin Abi Uyainah.
163 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 1/204, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 8/42, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/418. Al-Bukhari said: I see him as the brother of Al-Hajjaj. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Al-Hajjaj, he was a poet and satirist who narrated stories, and was not among the people of knowledge.
164 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/165 and said: The brother of Yunus bin Abi Al-Furat; *Ta'jil al-Manfa'ah* 61.
165 - Al-Qurashi, their Mawla, Abu Al-Furat, Al-Basri the Shoemaker, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the sixth [generation], Ibn Hibban was incorrect in softening him / Kh T S Q; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 9/245, *Al-Majruhin* 3/139, *Al-Mizan* 4/483, *Al-Tahdhib* 11/446.
166 - The name of Abu Mani' is Yusuf, and it is said Ubaydullah bin Abi Ziyad Al-Rasafi, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the tenth [generation] / =

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
167 - And Mani' bin Abi Mani'.
168 - Hajar bin Abdul Jabbar bin Wa'il. ... 169 - And Said bin Abdul Jabbar.
170 - Hudayj bin Muawiyah bin Hudayj. ... 171 - And Al-Rahil bin Muawiyah. 172 - And Zuhayr bin Muawiyah.
173 - Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman. ... 174 - And Abdul Rahman bin Al-Yaman.
foot_note:
1. = Kh T; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/380, *Al-Thiqat* 8/202, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/207.
167 - Mentioned by Al-Azdi in the book *Man Wafaqa Ismuhu Kunyata Abihi* edited by the poor servant [author], biography number 53. Al-Azdi said: Mani' bin Abi Mani' is the brother of Al-Hajjaj bin Abi Mani'.
168 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/235 and said: The brother of Said bin Abdul Jabbar.
169 - Al-Hadrami Al-Kufi, weak (Da'if) from the seventh [generation], died in the year 158 / Tamyiz; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/495, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/43, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/53.
170 - The brother of Zaid (diminutive), truthful (Saduq) makes mistakes, from the seventh [generation], died before his brother in the year one hundred seventy something / S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/115, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/310, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/216. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Zuhayr.
171 - Rahil (with unpointed letters, diminutive), brother of Abu Khaythama Zuhayr, truthful (Saduq) from the seventh [generation] / T; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/332, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/515, *Al-Thiqat* 6/309, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/270. Ibn Abi Hatim, Ibn Hibban, and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Zuhayr.
172 - Al-Kufi, settled in Al-Jazira, trustworthy and firm (Thiqah Thabt) except that his hearing from Abu Ishaq was late, from the seventh [generation], died in the year 172, 173, or 174, and he was born in year 100 / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/427, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/588, *Al-Tabaqat* 6/376, *Al-Siyar* 8/162, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/351.
173 - Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman, and Al-Yaman's name is Husayl (with unpointed letters, diminutive) and it is said Hisl (with Kasra then Sukun) Al-Absi (with Ba') ally of the Ansar, a great Companion among the foremost, his father was also a Companion who was martyred at Uhud. Hudhayfah died at the beginning of Ali's caliphate in the year 36 / A; *Al-Tabaqat* 6/15, *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/65, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/256, *Al-Siyar* 2/361, *Al-Isabah* 8/44, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/219.
174 - Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Hudhayfah, and it is said his nephew, Ibn Hibban considered him trustworthy, and some mentioned him among the Companions / D; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/10, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 5/399, *Al-Thiqat* 5/124, *Al-Tahdhib* 6/364. Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Hudhayfah.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
175 - And Fatimah. ... 176 - And Khawlah.
177 - Hazm bin Mahran Al-Qati'i. ... 178 - And Suhayl bin Mahran.
179 - Hasan bin Salih bin Salih bin Hayy. ... 180 - And Ali bin Salih bin Salih.
181 - Al-Hasan bin Ali bin Asim bin Suhayb. ... 182 - Asim bin Ali.
183 - Al-Hasan bin Ali bin Affan. ... 184 - And Muhammad bin Ali bin Affan.
foot_note:
1. 175 - The sister of Hudhayfah, a female Companion, she has hadith, and it is said: Her name is Khawlah / S; *Usd al-Ghabah* 7/233, *Al-Isabah* 8/72, *Al-Tahdhib* 12/445.
176 - Female Companion, sister of Hudhayfah; *Usd al-Ghabah* 7/99, *Al-Isabah* 7/627.
177 - He is Hazm bin Abi Hazm, Al-Qati'i (with Damma on Qaf), Abu Abdullah Al-Basri, truthful (Saduq) hallucinates, from the seventh [generation], died in the year 175 / Kh; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/111, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/294, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/242.
178 - Abu Bakr Al-Basri, weak (Da'if), from the seventh [generation] / Bukhari; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 4/106, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/247, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/261. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Hazm.
179 - Al-Hamdani (with Sukun on Mim), Al-Thawri, trustworthy (Thiqah), jurist, worshipper, accused of Shi'ism, from the seventh [generation], died in the year 169, and his birth was in the year 100 / Bukhari, M 4; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/295, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/18, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/285.
180 - Abu Muhammad Al-Kufi, brother of Hasan, trustworthy (Thiqah), worshipper, from the seventh [generation], died in the year 151, and it is said later / M 4; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/280, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/190, *Al-Tahdhib* 7/232. Al-Bukhari and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Hasan, and Al-Hafiz added: They were twins.
181 - Al-Hafiz said in *Ta'jil al-Manfa'ah* 66: Ibn Hibban considered him trustworthy, Ibn Ma'in said he is nothing, and Ibn Adi said: His hadiths are straight and I hope there is no harm in him; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/31, *Al-Kamil* 2/734, *Al-Thiqat* 8/170, *Al-Mizan* 1/504, *Al-Lisan* 2/226.
182 - Al-Wasiti Abu Al-Hasan Al-Taymi, their Mawla, truthful (Saduq) perhaps hallucinates, from the ninth [generation], died in the year 221 / Kh T Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/491, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/348, *Al-Tahdhib* 7/49. Al-Hafiz said: And he is the brother of Al-Hasan bin Ali.
183 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/22, and said: We wrote from him and he is truthful; *Al-Thiqat* by Ibn Hibban 8/181.
184 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 9/141 and said: The brother of Husayn bin Ali bin Affan. =

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
185 - Al-Hasan bin Amr Al-Fuqaymi. ... 186 - And Fudayl bin Amr.
187 - And Hasan bin Qaza'ah. ... 188 - And Husayn bin Qaza'ah.
189 - Husayn bin Abi Al-Sari. ... 190 - And Muhammad bin Abi Al-Sari.
191 - Al-Husayn bin Ali bin Al-Walid. ... 192 - And Al-Walid bin Ali.
foot_note:
1. = Basim said: This is how it appeared in *Al-Thiqat*, and I think it is a misspelling of Hasan, and Allah knows best.
185 - Al-Fuqaymi (with Damma on Fa and Fatha on Qaf) Al-Kufi, trustworthy and firm (Thiqah Thabt), from the sixth [generation], died in the year 142 / Kh D S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/298, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/25, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/310. Al-Bukhari said: He heard from his brother Fudayl. Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Fudayl.
186 - Abu Al-Nadr Al-Kufi, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the sixth [generation], died in the year 110 / M Md T S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 7/120, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 7/73, *Al-Thiqat* 7/314, *Al-Tahdhib* 8/293. Everyone who wrote his biography from those mentioned above said: The brother of Al-Hasan bin Amr.
187 - Al-Hashimi, their Mawla, Al-Basri, truthful (Saduq) from the tenth [generation], died in the year 250 approximately / T S Q; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/34, *Tahdhib al-Kamal* 6/303, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/316.
188 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/188, and said: Abu Al-Hasan, the brother of Al-Hasan bin Qaza'ah.
189 - Al-Husayn bin Al-Mutawakkil bin Abdul Rahman bin Abi Al-Sari (with Fatha on the unpointed letter and Kasra on Ra'), weak (Da'if), from the eleventh [generation], died in the year 240 / Q; *Al-Thiqat* 8/189, *Tahdhib al-Kamal* 6/468, *Mizan al-Itidal* 1/536, *Al-Tahdhib* 6/468. Ibn Hibban, Al-Mizzi, Al-Dhahabi, and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Muhammad.
190 - Truthful (Saduq), knowledgeable, has hallucinations, from the tenth [generation], died in the year 238 / D; *Al-Mizan* 4/23, *Al-Tahdhib* 9/224. Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Al-Husayn.
191 - Al-Ju'fi Al-Kufi the Reciter, trustworthy (Thiqah), worshipper, from the ninth [generation], died in the year 203 or 204, and he was 84 or 85 years old / A; *Tabaqat Ibn Sa'd* 6/396, *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/381, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/55, *Tahdhib al-Kamal* 6/449, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/357. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: His brother Walid narrated from him.
192 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 8/150, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 9/12, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/554. They said: The brother of Al-Husayn.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
193 - Husayn bin Isa Al-Hanafi. ... 194 - And Sulaym bin Isa.
195 - Al-Husayn bin Mahdi Al-Ubulli. ... 196 - And Muhammad bin Mahdi.
197 - Husayn bin Uqbah Al-Fazari. ... 198 - And Zaid bin Uqbah.
199 - Husayn bin Qays bin Asim. ... 200 - And Al-Hakam bin Qays. ... 201 - And Al-Hakim bin Qays.
202 - Hafs bin Umar bin Abdul Rahman bin Awf. ... 203 - And Abdul Aziz bin Umar.
foot_note:
1. 193 - Abu Abdullah, weak (Da'if) from the eighth [generation] / D Q; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/60, *Al-Mizan* 1/545, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/364. Ibn Abi Hatim, Al-Dhahabi, and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Sulaym the Reciter.
194 - Mentioned by Al-Dhahabi in *Al-Mizan* 2/231 and said about him: The Reciter, an Imam in recitation; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 5/127, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/215, *Al-Mizan* 2/231.
195 - Al-Ubulli (with Damma on Hamza and Ba'), Abu Said Al-Basri, from the eleventh [generation], died in the year 247 / T Q; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/65, *Al-Thiqat* 8/188, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/372.
196 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 9/199, 122, and said: The brother of Al-Husayn bin Mahdi.
197 - Al-Kufi, truthful (Saduq) from the third [generation] / S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/4, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/194, *Al-Thiqat* 4/157, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/386. Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Zaid bin Uqbah.
198 - Trustworthy (Thiqah) from the third [generation] / D T S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/402, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/569, *Al-Thiqat* 4/257, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/419.
199 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 3/3, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/156. Al-Bukhari said: I see him as the brother of Hakim. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Hakim.
200 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/144, and said: The brother of Hakim bin Qays.
201 - Al-Minqari (with Kasra on Mim, Sukun on Nun, and Fatha on Qaf), Al-Basri. It is said he was born in the time of the Prophet, peace be upon him. Ibn Hibban mentioned him in *Thiqat Al-Tabi'in* / Bukhari S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/12, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/207, *Al-Thiqat* 4/160, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/451.
202 - Al-Madani, acceptable (Maqbul) from the fifth [generation] / D; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/365, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/177, *Al-Thiqat* 6/197, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/407.
203 - Mentioned by Al-Hafiz in *Al-Lisan* 4/36 and said: Ibn Al-Qattan said: His condition is unknown (Majhul Al-Hal).

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
204 - Al-Hakam bin Abdullah bin Sa'd. ... 205 - And Sa'd bin Abdullah.
206 - Hukaym bin Abdullah bin Qays. ... 207 - And Muhammad bin Abdullah. 208 - And Al-Muttalib bin Abdullah.
209 - Hammad bin Al-Hajjaj. ... 210 - And Shu'bah bin Al-Hajjaj.
211 - Himman Al-Huna'i. ... 212 - And Abu Al-Shaykh.
foot_note:
1. 204 - Ibn Al-Mubarak was severe against him, and Ahmad said: His hadiths are all fabricated; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/345, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/120, *Al-Mizan* 1/572, *Al-Lisan* 2/332. Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Sa'd.
205 - Truthful (Saduq) from the sixth [generation] / Md; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 4/60, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/90, *Al-Thiqat* 6/376, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/476. Everyone who wrote his biography from those mentioned above said: The brother of Al-Hakam.
206 - Hukaym (with Damma on Ha'), settled in Egypt, truthful (Saduq) from the fourth [generation], died in the year 118 / M 4; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/94, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/286, *Al-Thiqat* 4/182, *Al-Tahdhib* 2/453. Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Muhammad and Al-Muttalib.
207 - Acceptable (Maqbul) from the sixth [generation] / M; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/130, *Al-Jarh* 7/303, *Al-Tahdhib* 9/270. Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Al-Muttalib. Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Hukaym.
208 - Acceptable (Maqbul) from the sixth [generation] / T; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 8/7, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 8/359, *Al-Thiqat* 7/506, *Al-Tahdhib* 10/179.
209 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 3/24, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/135, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/219. They said: The brother of Shu'bah.
210 - Ibn Al-Ward Al-Ataki, their Mawla, Abu Bistam Al-Wasiti then Al-Basri, trustworthy, Hafiz, precise, was a worshipper, from the seventh [generation], died in the year 160 / A; *Al-Tabaqat* 7/280, *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 4/244, *Al-Jarh* 1/126, *Al-Siyar* 7/202, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/338.
211 - Himman with Kasra on the first letter, and it is said (with Fatha and Damma and Nun at the end), and it is said Humran, and he is the brother of Abu Al-Shaykh Al-Huna'i (with Damma on Ha and lightened Nun). Covered (Mastur) from the third [generation] / S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/129, *Al-Jarh* 3/312, *Al-Thiqat* 4/191, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/23. Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Abu Al-Shaykh.
212 - Al-Basri, it is said his name is Haywan (with unpointed or pointed letters) bin Khalid, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the third [generation] / D S; *Al-Tabaqat* 7/155, *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/130, *Al-Tahdhib* 12/129.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
213 - Hamzah bin Masruq. ... 214 - And Said bin Masruq. ... 215 - Hamzah bin Husaym.
216 - And Khallad bin Husaym. ... 217 - Humayd bin Qays Al-A'raj.
218 - And Umar bin Qays. ... 219 - Al-Hallal bin Abi Al-Hallal.
220 - And Rabi'ah bin Abi Al-Hallal. ... 221 - And Zurarah bin Abi Al-Hallal.
Letter Kha'
222 - Kharijah bin Mus'ab. ... 223 - And Umar bin Mus'ab.
foot_note:
1. 213 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 3/51, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/215, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/229, and said: The brother of Said. Al-Bukhari said: The uncle of Sufyan.
214 - The father of Sufyan, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the sixth [generation], died in the year 126, and it is said later / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/513, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/66, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/82.
215 - Abu Nu'aym Al-Bushanji. Abu Hatim said about him: Truthful (Saduq); *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/217. Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/209.
216 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/368 and said: The brother of Hamzah.
217 - Abu Safwan the Reciter, there is no harm in him, from the sixth [generation], died in the year 130 and it is said later / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 2/352, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/227, *Al-Thiqat* 6/189, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/46. Everyone who wrote his biography from those mentioned above said: The brother of Umar bin Qays.
218 - Known as Sandal, abandoned (Matruk) from the seventh [generation] / Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/187, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/129, *Al-Mizan* 3/218, *Al-Tahdhib* 7/490. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Humayd.
219 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/190; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/120, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/306.
220 - Al-Hafiz said in *Al-Lisan* 2/448: He was not authenticated, and he is not well known, as if he is the brother of Zurarah; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/285, *Al-Jarh* 3/474.
221 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/343; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/439, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/604, *Al-Lisan* 2/474.
222 - Abu Al-Hajjaj Al-Sarkhasi, abandoned (Matruk), he used to practice Tadlis from liars, and it is said that Ibn Ma'in called him a liar, from the eighth [generation], died in the year 168 / T Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/205, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/375, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/76.
223 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/188 and said: The brother of Kharijah bin Mus'ab, and he was the first newborn =

text:
224 - Khalid bin Abi Ayyub. ... 225 - And Abdullah bin Abi Ayyub.

foot_note:
1. = born in Sarkhas in Islam.
224 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/322, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/198.
225 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 5/11 and said: The brother of Khalid bin Abi Ayyub.
226 - Khidash (with Kasra on Kha and lightened Dal), Abu Al-Haytham Al-Muhallabi their Mawla, Al-Basri, truthful (Saduq) makes mistakes, from the tenth [generation], died in the year 224 / Bukhari, M Kd S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/146, *Al-Jarh* 3/327, *Al-Thiqat* 8/225, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/85.
227 - Al-Hafiz said: It is said: The brother of Khalid, truthful (Saduq) from the tenth [generation], and he is among the senior Sheikhs of Al-Nasa'i / S; *Al-Tahdhib* 10/74.
228 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 8/226 and said: The brother of Al-Walid bin Abdul Malik, very straight in Hadith.
229 - Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 9/10 and said: Truthful (Saduq), and mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 9/227.
230 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 3/167, and Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/346. They said: The brother of Muhammad bin Fada'.
231 - Abu Bahr Al-Basri, weak (Da'if), from the sixth [generation] / D T Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/209, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 8/56, *Al-Tahdhib* 9/40. Al-Bukhari said: The brother of Khalid.
232 - Abu Ibrahim, Homsi and it is said Dimashqi, truthful (Saduq), jurist, from the second [generation] / D T S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/170, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/349, *Al-Thiqat* 4/205, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/115. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Al-Ala'.
233 - Al-Shami, it is said: The brother of Khalid, from the fourth [generation] / T; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/507, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/360, *Al-Thiqat* 5/245, *Al-Tahdhib* 8/191. Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Khalid.
234 - He is Khalid bin Mahran Abu Al-Manazil, Al-Basri Al-Hadhdha' (the Shoemaker), trustworthy (Thiqah), performs Mursal, from the fifth [generation] / A; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/173, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/352, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/120.
235 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 7/438 and said: The brother of Khalid Al-Hadhdha' through his mother, he narrates from Khalid Al-Hadhdha'.

Letter Dal
242 - Dawud bin Bakr bin Abi Al-Furat. ... 243 - And Abdul Malik bin Bakr.
244 - Dawud bin Abi Asim bin Urwah bin Mas'ud. ... 245 - And Abdul Malik bin Abi Asim.
foot_note:
1. 236 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 3/183, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/358, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/267, and said: The brother of Al-Walid.
237 - Abu Hashim Al-Basri, covered (Mastur) from the eighth [generation] / Md; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 9/21, and *Al-Tahdhib* 11/158. Ibn Abi Hatim and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Khalid bin Yazid.
238 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 3/212, and Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/388.
239 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari 5/333, and Ibn Abi Hatim 5/271. They said: The brother of Khuthaym bin Arak.
240 - Companion, witnessed Badr; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/216, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/392, *Usd al-Ghabah* 2/148, *Al-Isabah* 2/346.
241 - Companion, the Prophet, peace be upon him, placed him over the archers on the day of Uhud; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 5/34, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/27, *Usd al-Ghabah* 3/194, *Al-Isabah* 4/35. Al-Bukhari, Ibn Al-Athir, and Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Khawwat bin Jubayr.
242 - Al-Ashja'i, their Mawla, Al-Madani, truthful (Saduq) from the seventh [generation] / D T Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/235, *Al-Jarh* 3/407, *Al-Thiqat* 6/281, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/180. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Abdul Malik bin Bakr.
243 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in the biography of his brother as stated above.
244 - Al-Thaqafi Al-Makki, trustworthy (Thiqah) / Kh T D S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/230, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/421, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/189.
245 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 5/427, Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 5/362, and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/104. Al-Bukhari said: I reckon him to be the brother of Dawud bin Abi Asim. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Dawud.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
Letter Ra'
246 - Rabih bin Abdul Rahman bin Abi Said. ... 247 - And Said bin Abdul Rahman.
248 - Al-Rabi' bin Sa'd. ... 249 - And Mas'ud bin Sa'd.
250 - Rabi'ah bin Jawshan. ... 251 - And Abdul Rahman bin Jawshan.
252 - Rabi'ah bin Najidh. ... 253 - And Abu Sadiq.
254 - Rawh bin Al-Qasim Al-Tamimi. ... 255 - And Hisham bin Al-Qasim.
foot_note:
1. 246 - Al-Khudri Al-Madani, it is said: His name is Said and Rabih is a nickname, acceptable (Maqbul) from the seventh [generation] / D Tm Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/331, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/518, *Al-Thiqat* 6/309, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/238. Al-Bukhari said: I see him as the brother of Said. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Said.
247 - Acceptable (Maqbul) from the seventh [generation], and it is said he is Rabih / M; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/490, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/42, *Al-Thiqat* 6/352, *Al-Tahdhib* 4/55. Al-Hafiz said: Ibn Sa'd mentioned that this Said is nicknamed Rabih, and the most likely view is that they are brothers.
248 - Al-Ju'fi, Kufi. Al-Hafiz said in *Al-Lisan* 2/445: He is hardly known; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/275, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/462, *Al-Thiqat* 6/297.
249 - Abu Sa'd Al-Kufi, acceptable (Maqbul) from the sixth [generation] / M S; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 7/423, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 8/283, *Al-Tahdhib* 10/117. Al-Hafiz said: The brother of Al-Rabi'.
250 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 3/288, and Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 3/476. They said: The brother of Abdul Rahman.
251 - Al-Ghatfani, Basri, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the third [generation] / Bukhari 4; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 5/220, *Al-Tahdhib* 6/155.
252 - Al-Azdi Al-Kufi, it is said: He is the brother of Abu Sadiq who narrates from him, trustworthy (Thiqah) from the second [generation] / S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/281, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/473, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/263.
253 - It is said his name is Muslim bin Yazid, and it is said Abdullah bin Najidh, truthful (Saduq) and his hadith from Ali is Mursal, from the fourth [generation] / S Q; *Al-Tahdhib* 12/130.
254 - Abu Ghiyath, trustworthy (Thiqah), Hafiz, from the sixth [generation], died in the year 141 / Kh M D S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/309, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/495, *Al-Thiqat* 6/305, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/268.
255 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/570, and said: The brother of Rawh bin Al-Qasim. He was mentioned in *Al-Tahdhib* in the biography of his brother. Al-Hafiz said: Ahmad said: Rawh bin Al-Qasim and his brother Hisham =

foot_note:
1. = are among the trustworthy Basrans.
256 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 4/268 and said: The brother of Muhammad and Sulaiman; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/440, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/65.
257 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 4/8 and Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 6/387. They said: The brother of Muhammad bin Husayn; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 4/105.
258 - Al-Bukhari and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Sulaiman; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/62, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 7/235, *Al-Thiqat* 7/376.
259 - Al-Aslami Al-Madani, authenticated by Al-Nasa'i, from the third [generation] / D Kn; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/440, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/606, *Al-Thiqat* 4/268, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/326.
260 - Al-Bukhari said: I see him as the brother of Zur'ah. Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Zur'ah; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/172, *Al-Jarh* 6/121, *Al-Thiqat* 5/150.
261 - Al-Taymi, their Mawla, Abu Yahya Al-Kufi, settled in Baghdad, and he is the brother of Yusuf. Trustworthy and great (Thiqah Jalil), memorizer, from the senior tenth [generation], died in the year 211 or 212 / Bukhari, M Md T S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/424, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/600, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/331.
262 - Al-Kufi, settled in Egypt, from the tenth [generation], died in the year 232, and it is said otherwise / Kh S, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 9/227, *Al-Thiqat* 9/280, *Al-Tahdhib* 11/417. Ibn Abi Hatim and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Zakariya bin Adi.
263 - Al-Dhahabi said in *Al-Mizan* 2/82: Unknown; *Al-Lisan* 2/490.
264 - Weak (Da'if) from the eighth [generation] / Tamyiz; *Al-Du'afa* by Al-Uqayli 4/395, *Al-Mizan* 4/367, *Al-Tahdhib* 1/195. Al-Uqayli, Al-Dhahabi, and Al-Hafiz said: From his brother Zahdam.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:

267 - Ziyad bin Amir. ... 268 - And Abdul Rahman bin Amir. ... 269 - And Mubashir bin Amir.
270 - Ziyad bin Abdullah bin Ulathah. ... 271 - And Muhammad bin Abdullah.
272 - Ziyad, grandfather of Al-Rabi' bin Anas. ... 273 - And Zaid, grandfather of Al-Rabi' bin Anas.
274 - Ziyadah bin Abdullah bin Zaid. ... 275 - And Allaqah bin Abdullah.
foot_note:
1. 265 - Al-Hanzali or Al-Riyahi, Abu Jahmah Al-Basri, trustworthy (Thiqah), performs Mursal, from the fourth [generation] / M S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/349, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/529, *Al-Thiqat* 6/319, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/363.
266 - Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Ziyad; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 6/455, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 6/320, *Al-Thiqat* 7/250.
267 - Abu Hatim said: He is not strong; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/369, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/541, *Al-Lisan* 2/495.
268 - Mentioned by Al-Bukhari in his *Tarikh* 5/332 and said: The brother of Ziyad and Mubashir. Mentioned by Ibn Abi Hatim in *Al-Jarh* 5/269 and said: The brother of Ziyad, *Al-Thiqat* 7/92.
269 - Mentioned by Ibn Hibban in *Al-Thiqat* 7/507; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 8/11, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 8/342.
270 - Ulathah (with Damma on the unpointed letter and with the pointed letter), Al-Uqayli, Abu Suhayl Al-Harrani, he deputized for his brother in judgeship there, Ibn Ma'in considered him trustworthy, from the eighth [generation] / Q; *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/537, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/377. Ibn Abi Hatim said: He was a deputy for his brother in judgeship, and his brother Muhammad was the judge.
271 - Abu Al-Yasir Al-Harrani the Judge, truthful (Saduq) makes mistakes, from the seventh [generation], died in the year 168 / D S Q; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 1/132, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 7/302, *Al-Tahdhib* 9/269.
272 - Unknown (Majhul) from the third [generation] / D; *Al-Tahdhib* 3/391.
273 - The brother of Ziyad, unknown (Majhul) from the third [generation] like his brother / D; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/394, *Al-Thiqat* 4/248, *Al-Tahdhib* 3/430.
274 - Al-Bukhari, Ibn Abi Hatim, and Ibn Hibban said: The brother of Allaqah; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 3/446, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 3/619, *Al-Thiqat* 4/270.
275 - Al-Bukhari and Ibn Abi Hatim said: The brother of Ziyadah; *Al-Tarikh Al-Kabir* 7/91, *Al-Jarh wat-Ta'dil* 7/41, *Al-Thiqat* 5/286.

book_title: Supplement to What Was Missed Regarding Brothers and Sisters
publisher: Dar Al-Rayah for Publishing and Distribution, Riyadh - Saudi Arabia
text:
